meanings.definition: Theocentrisms: Beliefs or practices centered around the worship of a deity.
meanings.sent1: Many ancient civilizations had theocentrisms, where gods were worshipped.
meanings.sent2: Theocentrisms have influenced art, music, and rituals throughout history.
meanings.sent3: In a world of theocentrisms, even the smallest actions were believed to please the gods.
meanings.sent4: Theocentrisms are like a guiding light, shaping the moral compass of societies.
meanings.sent5: Theocentrisms painted the universe with divine colors, making everything sacred.

meanings.definition: Theocentrisms: The belief that God is the central focus of existence.
meanings.sent1: His theocentrisms led him to see God's hand in every aspect of life.
meanings.sent2: Theocentrisms provide comfort and purpose to many believers.
meanings.sent3: Even in everyday tasks, his theocentrisms reminded him of God's presence.
meanings.sent4: Theocentrisms are like a lens through which one views the world.
meanings.sent5: Her theocentrisms made her feel connected to something greater than herself.
